title: Packet loss to Chicago Servers
body:
Ping statistics for 104.160.131.1:
    Packets: Sent = 313, Received = 305, Lost = 8 (2% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:
    Minimum = 10ms, Maximum = 130ms, Average = 17ms

I'm getting packet loss to your servers only. Other servers and websites im pinging/playing to are giving me 0% packet loss. This happened recently in the latest patch. Sometime i would be right clicking and it shows the click in game but the champ doesn't move. Then it would go back to normal. Ping is showing normal 16ms consistently. Any help would be great. Thank You.

replies.body: I will be sending my pathping log and my ping -t log to the tech guys. Thanks for the help {{champion:17}}

Most of the time packet loss happens when your ISP routes your connection through a less than optimal route, or your connection hits a rough spot in one of the nodes it travels through. We might be able to adjust some settings here and there to get rid of some of that packet loss, so hit up our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with those network logs.
You neef to pathping the same ip to narrow it down. Type pathping instead of ping.
